intro: Smilax bona-nox subsp. wrightii, commonly known as Wright's smilax, is a perennial vine native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its stout, thorned stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into bright red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
